ygData.subject: RE: [EverQuest] EQIM: EverQuest Instant Messaging
ygData.msgSnippet: Maybe but I have to disagree for some business reasoning.  If you look at any company that has released new versions, they always tailor the SWITCH from one to
ygData.messageBody:
Maybe but I have to disagree for some business
reasoning. If you look at any company that has
released new versions, they always tailor the SWITCH
from one to antother. For instance, D&D 2nd edition
had a good following and most said they would stick
with it. WOTC marketed the 3rd edition in such a way
that most have now switched to that version.

I would think that at first EQ2 will be promoted with
the hint of EQ being supported but I think once the
bugs are worked out that it will be hard pushed.
Another analogy is Luclin. When it first came out,
most did not ever think of getting it. I for one had
it, and uninstalled it. But then BAM I give you the
Bazaar.

Now ask yourself who does not have it. I see more
people without Kunark and Velius than people who don't
have Luclin now.

BUT time will tell, I am sure EQ2 will get a great
following. After all its business and marketing.

Enjoy
--- Kyle Daigle <kyledaigletemp@...> wrote:
> The fear of loosing EQ for EQ2. honestly, I'm not
> really even sure which
> way I'm going with that. I don't believe EQ will
> die with EQ2 comes
> out. I believe both games will hold their ground.
> At the beginning of
> EQ2 it will get some major attention but I think EQ
> will recoup after
> that. Only time will tell.
>
> Kyle Daigle
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: David Langille
> [mailto:tuxedomystery2000@...]
> Sent: Tuesday, November 05, 2002 3:04 PM
> To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: Re: [EverQuest] EQIM: EverQuest Instant
> Messaging
>
> :( lovely, those money grubbers that never lower
> prices on games unless
> they're greatest hits own it.
> Prepare to lose Everquest for Everquest2 and EQOA
> very soon.
> Toni <silly_girl4ever@...> wrote:
> As you may/may not have noticed, Verants name is
> nowhere to be found
> inthe intro anymore. also, it is nowhere to be
> found on the PoP box
> either. So, don't blame Verant, blame Sony.
> ~Katashaka Naboombu
> Orion <orionv@...> wrote:
> Jaggedpine was months ago and yes to all the rest
> but what have they
> done for us lately. They led everyone to believe
> that all the /raid
> stuff would be free then bam you have to buy POP to
> get it. New bought
> spells in POP are Nodrop,etc.. Getting really tired
> of Verants attitude.
>

> Jaggedpine Forest was

> year ago there was The Warrens and Stonebrunt
> Mountains, and before that
> we had Paineel and The Hole.
>
> Honig Wayfarer
> 54 Ranger
> Cazic Thule
